FuncDescriptionShort: TD_AUTOARIMA fits the best ARIMA model to univariate time series.
FuncDescriptionLong: The function searches the possible models within the order constrains in the function parameters.
returns the best ARIMA model based on the criterion provided by the INFOR_CRITERIA parameter.
The TD_AUTOARIMA function creates a six-layered ART table.

Description: Time series whose value can be REAL.
Input.LangName: data or object or newdata or ... --> Langauges team can work with UAF team to come up with this field

Description: The primary result containing the selected best model’s coefficients.
The primary result set is accessed using a SELECT statement.
Output.LangName: data or object or newdata or ... --> Langauges team can work with UAF team to come up with this field

Description: The secondary result set containing “goodness of fit” metadata, is described in this subsection.   This result set is generated in response to the FUNC_PARAMS (FIT_METRICS(1) having a passed in flag value of '1'.   The result set can be retrieved by invoking the TD_EXTRACT_RESULTS function against the analytical result table containing the metadata.
There is one result row returned for each unique series acted upon.
Output.LangName: data or object or newdata or ... --> Langauges team can work with UAF team to come up with this field

Description: The tertiary result set contains residuals from the fitting exercise.
The tertiary is accessed using the TD_EXTRACT_RESULTS utility function.
Output.LangName: data or object or newdata or ... --> Langauges team can work with UAF team to come up with this field

Description: The quaternary result set contains the best model context, which is used during the forecasting process.
The quaternary is accessed using the TD_EXTRACT_RESULTS utility function.
Output.LangName: data or object or newdata or ... --> Langauges team can work with UAF team to come up with this field

Description: The quinary result set contains the information criteria such as AIC and SBIC, and the order of the best model.
The quinary is accessed using the TD_EXTRACT_RESULTS utility function.
Output.LangName: data or object or newdata or ... --> Langauges team can work with UAF team to come up with this field

Description: The senary result set contains the roots information.
The senary is accessed using the TD_EXTRACT_RESULTS utility function.
Output.LangName: data or object or newdata or ... --> Langauges team can work with UAF team to come up with this field

Params.Name: MAX_PQ_NONSEASONAL
Description: The (p,q) order of the maximum autoregression (AR) and moving average (MA) parameters.

Params.Name: MAX_PQ_SEASONAL
Description: The (P,Q) order of the max seasonal AR and MA parameters.

Params.Name: START_PQ_NONSEASONAL
Description: The start value of (p,q). Only used when STEPWISE(1).

Params.Name: START_PQ_SEASONAL
Description: The start value of seasonal (P,Q). Only used when STEPWISE(1).

Params.Name: d
Description: The order of first-differencing. Default is -1 (auto search d).

Params.Name: Ds
Description: The order of seasonal-differencing. Default: -1 (auto search Ds)).

Params.Name: MAX_d
Description: Maximum number of non-seasonal differences.

Params.Name: MAX_Ds
Description: Maximum number of seasonal differences.

Params.Name: PERIOD
Description: The number of periods per season. For non-seasonal data, period is 1.

Params.Name: STATIONARY
Description: If true, the the function restricts search to stationary models. A value of 1 means true. A value of 0 means false.

Params.Name: SEASONAL
Description: If false, then the function restricts search to non-seasonal models. A value of 1 means true. A value of 0 means false. Default is 1, meaning search all models including seasonal.

Params.Name: CONSTANT
Description: Indicator that TD_AUTOARIMA function include an intercept. A value of 1 means CONSTANT/intercept should be included. A value of 0 means CONSTANT/intercept should not be included.

Params.Name: ALGORITHM
Description: The approach used by TD_AUTOARIMA to estimate the coefficients.

Params.Name: FIT_PERCENTAGE
Description: Percentage of passed-in sample points used for the model fitting (parameter estimation). The default is 100, meaning 100%.

Params.Name: INFOR_CRITERIA
Description: Information criterion to be used in model selection. Options are AIC, AICc, BIC.

Params.Name: STEPWISE
Description: If true, then the function does stepwise selection. If false, the the function selects all models. A value of 1 means true. A value of 0 means false.

Params.Name: NMODELS
Description: Maximum number of models considered in the stepwise search.

Params.Name: MAX_ITERATIONS
Description: The maximum number of iterations that can be employed to non-linear optimization procedure.

Params.Name: COEFF_STATS
Description: Indicator to return coefficient statistical columns TSTAT_VALUE and TSTAT_PROB. A value of 1 means return the columns. A value of 0 means do not return the columns.

Params.Name: FIT_METRICS
Description: Indicator to generate the secondary result set that contains the model metadata statistics. A value of 1 means generate the secondary result set. A value of 0 means do not generate the secondary result set.

Params.Name: RESIDUALS
Description: Indicator to generate the tertiary result set that contains the model residuals. A value of 1 means generate the tertiary result set. A value of 0 means do not generate the tertiary result set.

Params.Name: ARMA_ROOTS
Description: Indicator to generate the senary result set that contains the inverse AR and MA roots of result best model that TD_AUTOARIMA selected (the model in the primary output layer). There should be no inverse roots showing outside of the unit circle. A value of 1 means generate result set. A value of 0 means do not generate a result set.

Params.Name: TEST_NONSEASONAL
Description: Nonseasonal unit root test used to choose differencing number d.
TD_AUTOARIMA function only uses ADF test for nonseasonal unit root test.

Params.Name: TEST_SEASONAL
Description: Seasonal unit root test used to choose differencing number D.
TD_AUTOARIMA function only uses OCSB test for seasonal unit root test.

OutputFmt.Name: INDEX_STYLE
Description: [Optional] User can choose between an index style of NUMERICAL_SEQUENCE or FLOW_THROUGH.
